Key Match Events: Nola went just 4 2/3 innings allowing five runs (four earned) on nine hits (two homers) and two walks while striking out five.
Post-Match Reflections: Nola's command was off from the start.
Nola worked with a tweaked arsenal, leaning on his four-seam fastball and knuckle curve more than usual.

Stubbs helped Nola navigate the Marlins’ less experienced lineup, and also bailed Nola out a bit offensively by bunting in his first two plate appearances and laying down a bunt for an RBI single in the fifth.
Stubbs caught a popup in foul territory to end a troublesome fifth inning, narrowly avoiding a collision with first baseman Bryce Harper.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Nola's shortest start since June 13, when he went 3 2/3 vs. the Red Sox.
Stubbs took advantage of Miami’s equally inexperienced defense, opting to bunt in his first two plate appearances -- and reaching base both times.
Stubbs quickly scored on a sacrifice fly from Kyle Schwarber.
Stubbs laid another bunt down the third-base line for an RBI single.
